ovdesc.p: TVerify Parameter File, Used to define the mode and other definitions

desc.p: The path name, to store the captured transactions. Max 50 alphanumeric characters are allowed to input. An error message is displayed, if the existing path is not specified. eg., ../TestBase.run/TRANS.LOG
In-directory defined in BATCH FILE listener of tcserver

The name of directory, that stores the playback transactions. Max 35 alphanumeric characters are allowed to input. No need to specify the entire path, just the existing directory name alone is enough eg., SEAT.IN
ID must be given as SYSTEM, a parameter file for T-verify and also it is a common file specific to all the companies.
The value in this field signifies the number of days. The transactions in the log will be retained for the number of days
Based on the value in this field LOG values are purged.
If the value given in this field is 1, and we kept 3 days log in TRANS.LOG. Now we are running COB, last one day transaction will be
retained in log. The other days log will be purged during COB
The n number of transactions, that needs to be stored in every captured log file. Max 6 numeric digits are allowed to input. No commas are allowed. eg., 10000
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
The bank date, when we start the transaction capture for the first time. No input field. This field value will be updated automatically.
The number of sessions, that the sequencer service is going to run.

The types of capture/playback techniques. A mandatory input. Max 4 characters are allowed to input and the types are available in the drop-down list. There are six types such as CT,CTFR,CTUR,CR,TT and NONE. Where CT stands for Capture transactions only, CTFR - Capture transactions with formatted results. CTUR - Capture transactions with un-formatted results, CR - Check results only, TT- Test transactions, NONE - No need to capture/playback transactions. The user can choose the required capture type, as per his/her business requirement.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
